page.description: Converts a character string to a numeric value.

argument.name: character
argument.description: A character string containing number characters

page.discussion: VAL() converts a Character_String to a numeric value. If the Character_String contains leading non-numeric characters, then a value of 0 is returned.

section.description: Assume that you have an inventory table with a PARTNO field that contains values such as "PH12" and "AK7864", etc. The field's first two characters contain a character code, and the remaining characters (up to four) are a number. To find all the parts with numbers between 20 and 4000, regardless of the code in the first two character positions, use the following filter expression:
section.example: val( substr( PARTNO, 3, 4)) > = 20 .AND. val( substr( PARTNO, 3, 4)) < = 4000
